Draft

Document upload

Document upload is for uploading files of various types

Concerns

  • Is each doc type considered a "doc upload" component? ie. "Passport Document Upload Component" and "Drivers License Document Upload Component" ...Possibly with a generic "Doc Upload" component
  • The "Existing File" tab only makes sense if there are scenarios where a previously uploaded document for another doc type could be re-used. I don't think we should allow this. Each document type should satisfy a specific need and if they have already provided a document to specify that need, the UI should note that it's already satisfied

Example

Drivers License

Issued by state. May include non-drivers’ ID

Required

1) Attach a file

Drag file into this space or

Existing file #1

Existing file #2

Existing file #3

2) Write a brief description (optional) You can add anything information you feel might be helpful to the SBA or use this space to ask questions about the document.

200 characters remaining

Completed example

Passport

Scan page with passport number from book

Required

1) Attach a file

Drag file into this space or

2) Write a brief description (optional) You can add anything information you feel might be helpful to the SBA or use this space to ask questions about the document.

200 characters remaining

Another example

Attach additional document

Add new document

1) Add a title

2) Add the file

Drag file into this space or

3) Write a brief description (optional) You can add anything information you feel might be helpful to the SBA or use this space to ask questions about the document.

200 characters remaining 

  
  <div class="sba-c-doc-upload">
    <!-- Primary heading content...visible stuff when closed -->
    <div class="sba-c-doc-upload__primary-heading">
      <h3>Drivers License</h3>
      <!-- <span>already on file</span> -->
      <p>Issued by state. May include non-drivers’ ID</p>
      <em>Required</em>
      <!-- Button to toggle the doc upload content -->
      <button class="sba-c-button sba-c-button--transparent sba-c-doc-upload__toggle" type="button" title="remove" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="doc-upload1">add file</button>
    </div>
    <!-- Primary contents of doc upload. Shown when expanded -->
    <div id="doc-upload1" class="sba-c-doc-upload__content">
      <p>1.) Attach a file</p>
      <input id="new-file" type="radio" name="tabs" checked>
      <label for="new-file">New file</label>
      <input id="existing-file" type="radio" name="tabs">
      <label for="existing-file">Existing file</label>
      <section id="new-file">
        <div class="sba-c-doc-upload__file-input">
          <span>
            Drag file into this space or
            <label for="file-picker">choose a file</label>
            <input type="file" id="file-picker" accept=".pdf" style="display: none" />
          </span>
        </div>
      </section>
      <section id="existing-file">
        <div class="sba-c-doc-upload__file-list">
          <p>Existing file #1</p>
          <p>Existing file #2</p>
          <p>Existing file #3</p>
        </div>
      </section>
      <p>2) Write a brief description (optional)
      You can add anything information you feel might be helpful to the SBA or use this space to ask questions about the document.</p>
      <textarea maxlength="200"></textarea>
      <em class="sba-u-margin-bottom--3">200 characters remaining</em>
      <button class="sba-c-button" type="button" title="add-file">Add file</button>
      <button class="sba-c-button sba-c-button--transparent sba-c-doc-upload__cancel" type="button" title="cancel">Cancel</button>
    </div>
  </div>

Guidance

  • Each component uses a unique id via the "aria-controls" tag that corresponds to a div with matching id
  • Use the input `accept` attribute to limit types of files that can be uploaded
